scopecontent.p: This is a collection of letters related to yellow fever epidemics in Philadelphia. The collection includes one letter from 1794 to William Smith, Jr. of Philadelphia. The letter references the "unfortunate distemper in Philadelphia" and mentions the death of Mr. Lea and his son. The other three letters are dated 1799; one is to Maria Hodge in Philadelphia, from her brother who desires her to come to Virginia, where there is no fever; and two are from Dav. Meredith to his brother and mostly discuss business, but mention that the fever is beginning to improve.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
